title: Computable real function
summary: In mathematical logic, specifically computability theory, a function f : R → R {\displaystyle f\colon \mathbb {R} \to \mathbb {R} } is sequentially computable if, for every computable sequence { x i } i = 1 ∞ {\displaystyle \{x_{i}\}_{i=1}^{\infty }} of real numbers, the sequence { f ( x i ) } i = 1 ∞ {\displaystyle \{f(x_{i})\}_{i=1}^{\infty }} is also computable.
